name: Almightree: The Last Dreamer
description: The world is shattering and you are the only hope to restore the balance. A thrilling and challenging 3D puzzle platformer game, Almightree: The Last Dreamer has you racing through a crumbling world to find your way to awaken the life giving Almightree.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0c compatible Storage: 300 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Not the worst game of its type. Better than Isaac The Adventurer, not as good or as challenging as something like Do Not Fall; I kind of spent the whole time thinking that I should play Catherine instead.
Very nice and is a relaxing game. The Graphics are so colorful and very beautiful.

A game that could have been.  I liked the idea. The puzzle immediately reminded me of the game Catherine, on Playstation, which was AMAZING. It also featured a block-based puzzle where you could go head to head with your friend.  However, Almightree fails to deliver. The puzzles are fine, but the game simply does not feel polished enough.  The controls are really clunky, and unresponsive. The head to head is very awkward. It's just weird that you cannot spectate your friend once you're dead to see his progress, and instead needs to wait in the dark until he's done.  I liked the concept of the game, but I definitely did not like the execution.
